atten3.ptxt: When installing the parts indicated by arrows, coat them with power steering fluid (see page ).

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL VANE PUMP HOUSING OIL SEAL

s2.ptxt: Using SST and a press, press in a new oil seal.

item.ptxt: Make sure to install the oil seal facing the correct direction.
Be careful not to damage the oil seal.

s2.ptxt: Coat the shaft with power steering fluid.
Tape the serrated part of the shaft.

atten3.ptxt: Be careful not to damage the oil seal.

s2.ptxt: Gradually insert the vane pump shaft.

atten3.ptxt: Do not damage the lip of the vane pump housing oil seal in the vane pump housing front.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL FRONT VANE PUMP SIDE PLATE

s2.ptxt: Coat a new No. 2 O-ring with power steering fluid.
Install the No. 2 O-ring to the front housing.
Coat a new No. 1 O-ring with power steering fluid.
Install the No. 1 O-ring to the front side plate.
Install the front side plate to the front housing while aligning the semicircle-shaped cuts of both parts.

atten3.ptxt: Be sure to install the plate in the correct position and direction.

s2.ptxt: With the inscribed mark facing upward, install the vane pump cam ring to the vane pump front housing while aligning the semicircle-shaped cuts of both parts.

atten3.ptxt: Be sure to install the plate in the correct position and direction.

s2.ptxt: Install the vane pump rotor to the front vane pump housing.

atten4.ptxt: The top and bottom of the vane pump rotor are symmetrical.

s2.ptxt: Coat the 10 vane pump plates with power steering fluid.
Install the 10 vane pump plates.

atten3.ptxt: Make sure that the round ends of the vane pump plates are facing outward.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL VANE PUMP SHAFT SNAP RING

s2.ptxt: Using a screwdriver and snap ring expander, install a new snap ring to the shaft with pulley.
Coat a new O-ring with power steering fluid and install it onto the rear housing.
Align the straight pin of the rear housing with the hole created by the semicircle-shaped cuts of the cam ring, front side plate and front housing. Then install the rear housing with the 4 bolts.

atten3.ptxt: Make sure that the O-ring is not out of position before installing the rear vane pump housing.

s2.ptxt: Check that the pump rotates smoothly without abnormal noise.
Temporarily install the service bolt.
Using a torque wrench, check the pump rotating torque.
If the rotating torque is not as specified, check the installation of the housing oil seal.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL POWER STEERING OIL PRESSURE SWITCH

s2.ptxt: Coat a new O-ring with power steering fluid and install it to the oil pressure switch.
Install the oil pressure switch onto the vane pump.
Coat the compression spring and flow control valve with power steering fluid.
Install the compression spring.
Install the flow control valve facing in the correct direction.
Coat a new O-ring with power steering fluid and install it onto the pressure port union.
Install the pressure port union.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL VANE PUMP OIL RESERVOIR SUB-ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Coat a new O-ring with power steering fluid, and install it to the vane pump reservoir.
Install the vane pump reservoir to the vane pump with the 3 bolts.
